quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: South America and Tiger
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, fluviatilis, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does the South American snake Lachesis muta, commonly known as South American bushmaster, do when it feels threatened?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It starts vibrating its tail.

questions.question: Tiger sharks usually hunt alone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The vicuna, a South American animal, is a close relative of this other animal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Llama

questions.question: What common name is used to denote the dolphin species Sotalia fluviatilis, indigenous to South America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of the tiger shark?

options.text: They give birth to live young.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They give birth to live young.

questions.question: What is the smallest species of deer in the world, found only in South America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Northern Pudu

questions.question: What makes the Scarlet Macaw, a parrot species indigenous to South America, unsuitable for a pet?

options.text: It is a high maintenance pet.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the capybara, the largest rodent on the planet, indigenous to South America?

options.text: Its front legs are a little longer than the rear legs.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What type of animal is the Gold tegu, found in South America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reptile

questions.question: What type of mammal is the Culpeo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wild dog

questions.question: What color is the head of the South American stork Jabiru, whose body is predominantly white?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black

questions.question: What time of day does the tiger shark usually hunt?

options.text: They hunt at different times throughout the day

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nighttime

questions.question: The tiger shark reaches a length of 10 ft to 20 ft.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The tiger shark is considered highly dangerous to humans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Unlike most sharks, the tiger shark does not grow a replacement tooth every time one is lost.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Omnivores and Body
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, nicknames, raven. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the meaning of the word Sarcophilus, the name of the genus that the Tasmanian devil belongs to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meat-lover

questions.question: What is the prevailing color of the fur of the Tasmanian devil?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black

questions.question: Skunks, which are omnivorous mammals, are one of the primary predators of these animals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Honeybees

questions.question: What bizarre food would pigs occasionally eat, being omnivores?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Tiger sharks are know to eat garbage that is thrown in the water by humans.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Tiger sharks give birth to up to 12 live young at a time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what part of their body do Tasmanian devils store body fat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tail

questions.question: Most bear species are omnivores and their diet consists mainly of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mast

questions.question: How long is the gestation period for a female tiger shark?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 15-16 months

questions.question: Which of these is true about raccoons?

options.text: They do not produce enough saliva to moisten their food
They use their front paws to examine their food and remove unwanted parts
Only wild raccoons douse their food

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They use their front paws to examine their food and remove unwanted parts

questions.question: What is the main food source for the sloth, an omnivorous mammal living in Central and South America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leaves

questions.question: Which of these statements is NOT true about the Common Raven, a popular omnivorous bird?

options.text: It would feed on animal feces
It feeds on human food waste

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It wouldnt eat birds

questions.question: Which of these is one of the nicknames of the tiger shark?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wastebasket of the Sea

questions.question: Which of these is not within the natural diet of the omnivorous Eastern Box Turtle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Small amphibians

questions.question: What does the Latin word  omnivore stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eating everything

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Ants and Statements
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, cartoon, termites. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the Tasmanian devil cartoon character from Looney Tunes by Warner Bros.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taz

questions.question: What does the Tasmanian devil do when it feels stressed or threatened?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It produces a strong odour

questions.question: How many legs do ants have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6

questions.question: Which of these statements are wrong about the reproduction of the Tasmanian devil?

options.text: The female gives birth to 20-30 young

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The female has six nipples

questions.question: In May 2009 the Tasmanian devil was declared to be endangered because this disease had almost wiped out its population.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Facial cancer

questions.question: Which of these is true about ants diet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Most ants are omnivores.

questions.question: Ants communicate through pheromones.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about ants eyes and eyesight?

options.text: The eyesight of most ants ranges from poor to average, and a number of species that live underground are completely blind.
Ants have compound eyes which consist of multiple small lenses.
Ants have three simple eyes called ocelli on the top of their heads that detect light levels and polarization

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about Tasmanian devils?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are predominantly solitary animals

questions.question: What is the usual size range of mature ants?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: From 0.75 to 52 millimeters

questions.question: Termites are not actually ants.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: At what time of the day are Tasmanian devils most active?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: At night

questions.question: Which of these behaviors is typical of ant societies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these are a part of an ant colony?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What type of food do Tasmanian devils prefer in the wild?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carrion

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Species and Ants
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, frog, glider. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Where are the gliding membranes of the Draco lizard species positioned?

options.text: Between its front and hind legs
They do not have a gliding membrane

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On their elongated ribs

questions.question: This chemical is found in the venom of most ants and some other insects.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Formic acid

questions.question: Some small spider species, as well as the young of larger species, are known for floating in the wind. What is this activity commonly known as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ballooning

questions.question: What type of animal is the serval?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Feline

questions.question: Which of these ways of defence and attack do ants use?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What kind of organism is the Greater Glider, a gliding animal indigenous to Australia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mammal

questions.question: Of all the gliding animals, which one is the one best glider?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flying lemurs

questions.question: Which of these species of geckos is able to glide in the air after jumping or falling from a tree?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ptychozoon

questions.question: Which  frog is a skilled glider, able to make two types of turns midair?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chinese gliding frog

questions.question: The large tsetse fly, found in Africa, feeds on what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blood

questions.question: Some mammals are able to glide and parachute, but bats are the only ones capable of flying.  What is the name of the membrane that forms the surface of their wings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Patagium

questions.question: In what geographical region can you find the Paradise Flying Snake, also called Paradise Tree Snake?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Asia

questions.question: What is the largest crocodilian in Africa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nile crocodile

questions.question: Which of these mollusks is able to glide over in air for up to 50 meters (164 feet)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Squid

questions.question: In what ocean can the 50 species of Exocoetidae, also known as flying fish, be found?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Family and Cetaceans
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, males, phocoenidae. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What body part of the giraffe can indicate its gender?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horns

questions.question: Sometimes called the “hooked-finned” porpoise, this animal has a barely noticeable beak. It lives in the deep waters of the northern latitudes between North America and Asia, and is a very fast swimmer (up to 20 mph / 32 km/h). What is its name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pacific white-sided dolphin

questions.question: Males of this whale species have one tooth that can grow to be 10 feet (3 m) long.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Narwhal

questions.question: Which whale expels a reddish-brown fluid when threatened, much like an octopus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pygmy sperm whale

questions.question: Narwhals and belugas make up separate subspecies of cetaceans. However, taxonomists often include in it a dolphin which lives in Indo-Pacific waters. What is the name of this dolphin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Irrawaddy dolphin

questions.question: The family “phocoenidae” describe which group of cetacean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Porpoises

questions.question: In cetaceans, the species identification “rorqual” comes from the Norwegian word “rorhval” which means “furrow.” These furrows are obvious on all rorqual whales. Which of the following is not a rorqual whale?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beluga whale

questions.question: Right and gray whales have been over-fished almost to extinction. Which of the following is a gray or right whale?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bowhead whale

questions.question: The representatives of this type of dolphins have very small eyes, making them virtually blind. They rely on echolocation to find food and swim in turbid waters. They include the baiji and boto. What are they called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: River dolphins

questions.question: These cetaceans live off the southern coast of South America and can be found up to 150 miles (240 km) up the Amazon River. They are colored pale blue with a white underside. What is their name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tuxici

questions.question: What type of animal is the dik-dik, indigenous to Africa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antelope

questions.question: This family of cetaceans has representatives like the vaquita, the harbor, and spectacled type. They are shy and stay away from boats; however, they are particularly susceptible to fishing lines, nets, and other pollution. Which is the family?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Porpoises

questions.question: Adult Goliath beetles, found in Africas tropical forests, feed on what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fruits and tree sap

questions.question: The largest family of whales is the beaked whales (Ziphiidae). Most of the scarce information about this family has been found from dead specimens. Their teeth are the most distinctive aspect of these whales; most have only 2-4 oversized teeth. Which whale’s teeth erupt from bulges in the lower jaw?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blainville’s beaked whale

questions.question: The family “delphinidae” include which kind of cetacean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dolphins

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Planet and Animal
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, frog, reptile. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What animal is considered the smallest mammal in length on the planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kittis Hog-nosed Bat

questions.question: What does the diet of most penguin species primarily consist of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Where is its natural habitat of the smallest bird on the planet, the Bee Hummingbird?

options.text: Cuba and the Isle of Youth

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cuba and the Isle of Youth

questions.question: This oceanic dolphin has distinctive yellow patches on its sides. It is mostly found in the northern latitudes of the Atlantic Ocean.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlantic white-sided dolphin

questions.question: The Microraptor, the smallest known non-avian dinosaur, inhabited this modern day area during the early Cretaceous Period 130-125.5 million years ago.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China

questions.question: This tiny frog is the smallest amphibian in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brazilian Gold Frog

questions.question: Which of the following do orca NOT do with their food?

options.text: Use it as a teaching tool for young orca
Slam it on the surface of the water

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Regurgitate it for their young

questions.question: The largest penguin species on the planet is the Emperor Penguin. What is the smallest one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What type of animal is the smallest vertebrate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fish

questions.question: Which of these tiny bugs is considered the smallest beetle in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scydosella musawasensis

questions.question: What type of insect is the smallest known insect on the planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wasp

questions.question: What kind of animal is the smallest known reptile on the planet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gecko

questions.question: This popular dolphin often herds fish onto the beach in order to eat the stranded fish. As a result, the teeth on one side (usually the right) are worn down due to eating sand as well as the fish. Which is this dolphin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bottlenose dolphin

questions.question: The smallest turtle in the world, the Speckled Padloper Tortoise, inhabits which of these areas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Africa

questions.question: What bacterium is believed to be the smallest living organism that is capable to grow and reproduce independently?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mycoplasma genitalium
